etymology.description: 會意: 目 “eye” + 丨 “vertical stroke” — a vertical stroke above the eye indicating looking straight ahead; a later dot became a horizontal stroke (十-like).
etymology.interpretation: Combines an eye with a vertical line to depict gazing straight ahead, conveying straightness and uprightness. The top mark later flattened into a cross-stroke, reinforcing the sense of a straight, aligned axis.

examples.chinese: 请直走两百米(請直走兩百米)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng zhí zǒu liǎng bǎi mǐ.
examples.english: Please go straight for two hundred meters.

examples.chinese: 他为人正直(他為人正直)。
